title: Serif Font
author: VITAMINADO

comments.content: The first line is Goudy Old Style.

I like the match to the second line, but can't find current reference.  
CastCraft Software/OPTIClementeBookAd

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824090913im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oruj1_4832.jpg)

The typeface in the second line is Stempel Schneidler  
 [http://www.linotype.com/1501/StempelSchneidler-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824090913/http:/www.linotype.com/1501/StempelSchneidler-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/1501/StempelSchneidler-family.html")

Wonder who tilted the ‘o’ in the OPTI rip-off version though.
The OPTI Archive says that OPTI Clemente is Bauer Text

(CG) Bauer Text is the (former) Agfa-Compugraphic rip-off of Schneidler Mediaeval, designed by S. H. E. Schneidler for the Bauersche Gießerei in Frankfurt. I checked the Encyclopedia of Typefaces for a specimen. The o is not tilted there too.
